business.headline: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says manufacturing, services, AI to drive growthAt the World Economic Forum, Minister Ashwini Vaishnav outlined India's economic strategy based on four pillars: public investment in infrastructure, focus on manufacturing and innovation, inclusive growth, and simplification of laws.

EPFO simplifies personal profile updation process. Check steps hereEPF members can update their personal details like name, gender, date of birth, nationality and marital status without the need to submit any documents.

Is Donald Trump bluffing about his tariff threats?Donald Trump has been vocal about imposing 10% tariffs on imports from China, 25% on neighbouring Mexico and Canada, and the European Union (EU). He has even threatened to impose a 100% tariff on BRICS nations, including India.

Perplexity AI CEO calls Nandan Nilekani 'awesome' but his AI stance 'wrong' Aravind Srinivas called Nandan Nilekani "awesome" for his contributions to India's IT sector, but disagreed with the Infosys co-founder's stance on AI development.
Explained: Why HUL share price fell in early trade today HUL Stock price fell over 3% in early trade as investors reacted negatively to its Q3 results despite a 19% rise in net profit.

Stallion India share price: Stock lists at 33% premium over IPO price Stallion India shares opened at Rs 120 on both the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), translating to a premium of 33%.

India least vulnerable but Trump unpredictable person: Martin Wolf Martin Wolf, speaking on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos, said that India is least vulnerable to Donald Trump's tariff threat.

Should you convert your credit card bills into EMIs? Check hereCredit card EMI conversion: Converting credit card bills into EMIs offers immediate relief by breaking big payments into smaller and manageable amounts.
What is UPI Circle? 5 things you need to know UPI Circle is a solution where a primary user authorises a secondary user to make payments from their account.

IT rally saves the day on Dalal Steet; Wipro, Infosys among top gainersThe biggest gainers during the session were IT stocks, with the Nifty IT index rising 2.14%, the highest among all other sectoral indices.

Budget 2025: Why financial services sector needs a 'digital lending' boostBudget 2025 would play a key role in driving the country's economic growth through enhanced credit access to the rural and underserved sectors of the economy.

TCS, Wipro, Infosys: Why IT stocks rose today despite high market volatilityIT Stocks: TCS shares were up 3.04% to Rs 4,158.45 at 3:00 pm, Wipro gained 3.37% to trade at Rs 308.40, and Infosys jumped 3.11% to Rs 1,856.70.

entertainment.headline: Jaideep Ahlawat feels 'special' as Amul honours Hathi Ram from Paatal Lok 2Actor Jaideep Ahlawat shared a gratitude note on social media after Amul gave a shout-out to his character in the latest release, Paatal Lok Season 2. The actor plays the role of Hathi Ram Chaudhary.
The Family Man 3 wrap-up party: Manoj Bajpayee, Samantha pose for picsThe cast of The Family Man 3 has wrapped up shoot for the show. Makers Raj and DK shared photos from their wrap-up party.

Is Friends star David Schwimmer dating a student-activist? Here's the truthDavid Schwimmer, famed for his role in Friends, is in the limelight after being seen with medical student, Eliana Jolkovsky. The duo's outing in Beverly Hills has sparked rumours about their relationship.

TV actor Gurucharan Singh's father shares his health update: He's out of dangerTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Gurucharan Singh who was earlier hospitalised, is currently okay. His father shared his health update and said that the actor is out of danger now.

Ed Sheeran seeks recommendations for restaurants in IndiaEd Sheeran is all set to return to his favourite places on Earth -- India. Sharing a post on Instagram, he expressed his excitement for the upcoming "+ - = · x Tour".

Ricky Gervais pays tribute to After Life's dog Brandy: She was a very good girlActor Ricky Gervais has paid a sweet tribute to the dog from his show, After Life, after she died recently. The British comedian and producer shared the tribute on social media.

TV show CID to air Rishab Shetty's Kantara-inspired episode. DetailsThe popular TV show CID will air an episode dedicated to Rishab Shetty's Kantara. Ahead of that, pictures were released that feature Dayanand Shetty, aka Daya, in a similar appearance.

Boman Irani's directorial debut The Mehta Boys to release on this dateThe Mehta Boys OTT release date: Boman Irani and Avinash Tiwary's The Mehta Boys is set for its OTT premiere. The critically-acclaimed film will release on Prime Video in February.

House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Saif Ali Khan recounts attack to cops: Was with Kareena, suddenly heard screamingIn his statement to police, Saif Ali Khan said he and his wife Kareena Kapoor were in their bedroom when they heard screams from their house help, Eliyama Phillip. They rushed to the room of their son, Jeh, where they found an intruder.

US judge blocks Trump's birthright citizenship order: Blatantly unconstitutionalUS District Judge John Coughenour issued a temporary order restraining the Trump administration from implementing the order.

Elon Musk blames X algorithm amid 'Nazi salute' row: Gonna lose my mindElon Musk criticised the social media algorithm after encountering repeated "Nazi salute" images in his feed. The controversy stems from a gesture he made on January 20 during Donald Trump's inauguration.

Saif Ali Khan stabbing: Father of accused claims man seen on CCTV not his sonShariful Islam Shehzad's father claims the person in the CCTV footage isn't his son, citing the individual's long hair, whereas his son keeps his hair short.

Fashion mistakes that can cost you your healthContrary to popular belief, what you wear and how you carry yourself are not limited to displaying your penchant for style. These seemingly small choices could lead to health issues over time.

Semi-finals, Live Updates: Djokovic's big test against fiery ZverevAustralian Open semi-finals, Live Updates: As we move into the men's singles semi-finals, Novak Djokovic will be eyeing to continue his brilliant run in the tournament as he faces off against Alexander Zverev. Jannik Sinner is set to take on Ben Shelton in the other semi-final.

Make your product in America or pay tariff: Trump to economic leaders at DavosSpeaking at the World Economic Forum (WEF), Donald Trump said that while businesses are free to choose where they manufacture their goods, there would be financial consequences for opting out of US-based production.

59 diagnosed with rare brain condition in Pune: What is Guillain-Barre Syndrome?Around 59 people in Pune have been affected with Guillain-Barre Syndrome. It is a rare neurolgoical condition in which the body's immune system attacks the nerves.

Jaideep Ahlawat 'melted like Makhan' after Amul's 'Lok-priya snack' honourActor Jaideep Ahlawat shared a gratitude note on social media after Amul gave a shout-out to his character from his latest release, Paatal Lok Season 2. The actor plays the role of Hathi Ram Chaudhary.

Ashwini Vaishnaw breaks down India's 4-point plan to become developed nationSpeaking to Rahul Kanwal, News Director, India Today, on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum (WEF) 2025 in Davos, Ashwini Vaishnaw listed out the four pillars of the strategy charted out by the central government to become a developed country.

Trump declassifies John F Kennedy, Martin Luther King Jr assassination filesThe National Archives has released tens of thousands of records in recent years related to the November 22, 1963 assassination of president Kennedy but held thousands back, citing national security concerns.

Oscars 2025: Wicked, Emilia Perez lead the nominationsThe 97th Academy Awards nominees were announced today by Bowen Yang and Rachel Sennott. Originally scheduled for January 17, the announcement was delayed due to wildfires in Los Angeles.

Lean patch in Tests will not impact Kohli, Rohit's white-ball form: IrfanVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's poor red-ball exploits will not affect their white-ball form, says Irfan Pathan. Kohli and Rohit Sharma are expected to make their return in the ODI series against England.

BJP offered Chief Minister post when I was in Tihar: Manish Sisodia's big claimAAP leader Manish Sisodia has claimed that the BJP offered him the Chief Minister's position while he was lodged in the Tihar jail in return for switching allegiance.

I'm good for $80 billion: Satya Nadella's remark sparks back-and-forth with MuskWhen asked about the spat between Elon Musk and Open AI CEO Sam Altman during an interview, Microsoft chief Satya Nadella said, "All I know is, I'm good for my USD 80 billion. I'm going to spend USD 80 billion building out Azure".

Punjab Police withdraws Arvind Kejriwal's additional security, AAP protestsAAP leader Sanjay Singh alleged that the Delhi Police "forcibly" removed Arvind Kejriwal's Punjab Police security. He further claimed that goons armed with rods were present at the venue where the former Chief Minister was scheduled to hold a meeting.

Fingerprints collected from Saif Ali Khan's building match arrested accusedThe fingerprints collected from the duct pipe of Saif Ali Khan's Bandra home, along with those found on the door handle of Jeh's room and a bathroom door have matched the accused who was arrested in connection with the attack on the actor.

Loudspeaker not essential to religion: Bombay High Court on noise pollution lawsThe Bombay High Court directed the Maharashtra government to have an inbuilt mechanism to control decibel levels in their public address systems used by any religious bodies, irrespective of religion.

In pics: Migrant caravan leaves southern Mexico, heads for US borderA migrant caravan departed from Tapachula in Mexico, hours before President Donald Trump was set to assume office, heading toward the northern border with the United States. The majority of the migrants are from Venezuela, but they also include people from Guatemala, El Salvador, Peru and Ecuador. They've said they are tired of being blocked from crossing Mexico by the government.

Guide Amit Shah: Arvind Kejriwal on Yogi Adityanath's Delhi law and order chargeResponding to Yogi Adityanath's remarks on Delhi's law and order, Arvind Kejriwal suggested that the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister should guide Union Home Minister Amit Shah instead on the issue.

Trump pardons anti-abortion protesters day before 'March for Life' in WashingtonThe people had been tried for conspiring in 2020 to overrun a Washington reproductive health clinic and setting up a blockade to intimidate patients and staff.

JP Nadda vows Ayushman Bharat scheme in Delhi in 1st Cabinet meet if BJP winsThe announcement was made during a public rally the BJP national president addressed in Uttam Nagar, where he also outlined several welfare schemes and attacked the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government for its alleged failures and corruption.

Diljit Dosanjh on Panjab 95 facing delays: Truth will finally come outActor-singer Diljit Dosanjh shared a post on social media as his upcoming film, Panjab 95 has faced significant delays. The actor wrote that the truth would finally come out.

Andrew Flintoff's son, Rocky smashes hundred for England Lions vs AustraliaAndrew Flintoff's son Rocky hit his maiden century with the England Lions on Thursday, January 23. Rocky rescued his side from collapsing, hitting a brisk 108 off just 127 balls.

Aryna Sabalenka promises Paula Badosa 'shopping date' after semi-final winAfter securing a dominant win in the semi-finals of the Australian Open 2025, Aryna Sabalenka promised her good friend Paula Badosa a 'shopping date' on Thursday, January 23. Sabalenka defeated Badosa in straight sets.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
